privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: Privacy Policy for MemPhrase
privacy.intro.company: MemPhrase ("us", "we", or "our") operates the memphrase.example.com website (the "Service").
privacy.intro.purpose: This page informs you of our policies regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal data when you use our Service and the choices you have associated with that data.
privacy.collection.title: 1. Information Collection and Use
privacy.collection.main: Since MemPhrase primarily operates client-side for password generation, we do not collect personal data for the core password generation service. Settings are stored locally in your browser. We do not use analytics or tracking cookies for the core password generation functionality.
privacy.collection.contact: If you choose to use our optional Contact Us form, we will collect the information you provide (such as name, email address, and message content) solely for the purpose of responding to your inquiry.
privacy.data_types.title: Types of Data Collected via Contact Form
privacy.personal_data.title: Personal Data
privacy.personal_data.description: If you use our Contact Us form, we may ask you to provide us with certain personally identifiable information. This information may include, but is not limited to:
privacy.personal_data.name: Full Name
privacy.usage_data.title: Usage Data (General Website Visit - If Applicable)
privacy.usage_data.description: Our hosting provider may collect standard server logs which can include information such as your computer's Internet Protocol address (e.g. IP address), browser type, browser version, the pages of our Service that you visit, the time and date of your visit, and the time spent on those pages. This data is typically used for website maintenance and aggregated statistical analysis by the hosting provider and is not directly used by MemPhrase to identify individuals.
privacy.use_data.title: 2. Use of Data
privacy.use_data.description: MemPhrase uses the data collected via the Contact Us form for the following purposes:
privacy.use_data.respond: To respond to your inquiries and provide support.
privacy.use_data.improve: To improve our Service based on feedback received.
privacy.use_data.sharing: We do not sell or share your personal data provided through the contact form with third parties, except as required by law.
privacy.local_storage.title: 3. Local Storage of Settings
privacy.local_storage.description: MemPhrase utilizes your browser's local storage to save your password generation preferences (such as number of words, selected categories, separator character, etc.) for your convenience. This data is stored directly in your browser and is not transmitted to our servers or to any third party by MemPhrase. You can clear this data by clearing your browser's cache and local storage for this site.
privacy.security.title: 4. Security of Data
privacy.security.description: The security of your data is important to us. While the core password generation happens on your device and settings are stored locally, any data transmitted via the optional contact form will be handled with care. However, remember that no method of transmission over the Internet, or method of electronic storage is 100% secure. While we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect any Personal Data you send us, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.
privacy.children.title: 5. Children's Privacy
privacy.children.description: Our Service does not address anyone under the age of 18 ("Children"). We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from anyone under the age of 18. If you are a parent or guardian and you are aware that your Child has provided us with Personal Data via the contact form, please contact us. If we become aware that we have collected Personal Data from children without verification of parental consent, we take steps to remove that information.
privacy.changes.title: 6. Changes to This Privacy Policy
privacy.changes.description: We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page. We will update the "last updated" date at the top of this Privacy Policy. You are advised to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes.
privacy.contact.title: 7. Contact Us
privacy.contact.description: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us:
privacy.contact.form: By using the Contact Us form on our website.
terms.title: Terms and Conditions
terms.subtitle: Terms and Conditions for MemPhrase
terms.intro.title: 1. Introduction
terms.intro.welcome: Welcome to MemPhrase! These terms and conditions outline the rules and regulations for the use of MemPhrase's Website, located at memphrase.example.com.
terms.intro.acceptance: By accessing this website we assume you accept these terms and conditions. Do not continue to use MemPhrase if you do not agree to take all of the terms and conditions stated on this page.
terms.ip.title: 2. Intellectual Property Rights
terms.ip.description: Other than the content you own, under these Terms, MemPhrase and/or its licensors own all the intellectual property rights and materials contained in this Website. You are granted limited license only for purposes of viewing the material contained on this Website.
terms.restrictions.title: 3. Restrictions
terms.restrictions.intro: You are specifically restricted from all of the following:
terms.restrictions.publishing: publishing any Website material in any other media;
terms.restrictions.selling: selling, sublicensing and/or otherwise commercializing any Website material;
terms.restrictions.performing: publicly performing and/or showing any Website material;
terms.restrictions.damaging: using this Website in any way that is or may be damaging to this Website;
terms.restrictions.access: using this Website in any way that impacts user access to this Website;
terms.restrictions.illegal: using this Website contrary to applicable laws and regulations, or in any way may cause harm to the Website, or to any person or business entity;
terms.restrictions.mining: engaging in any data mining, data harvesting, data extracting or any other similar activity in relation to this Website;
terms.restrictions.advertising: using this Website to engage in any advertising or marketing.
terms.content.title: 4. Your Content
terms.content.description: In these Website Standard Terms and Conditions, "Your Content" shall mean any audio, video text, images or other material you choose to display on this Website. By displaying Your Content, you grant MemPhrase a non-exclusive, worldwide irrevocable, sub licensable license to use, reproduce, adapt, publish, translate and distribute it in any and all media. Your Content must be your own and must not be invading any third-party's rights.
terms.warranties.title: 5. No warranties
terms.warranties.description: This Website is provided "as is," with all faults, and MemPhrase express no representations or warranties, of any kind related to this Website or the materials contained on this Website.
terms.liability.title: 6. Limitation of liability
terms.liability.description: In no event shall MemPhrase, nor any of its officers, directors and employees, shall be held liable for anything arising out of or in any way connected with your use of this Website whether such liability is under contract. MemPhrase, including its officers, directors and employees shall not be held liable for any indirect, consequential or special liability arising out of or in any way related to your use of this Website.
terms.indemnification.title: 7. Indemnification
terms.indemnification.description: You hereby indemnify to the fullest extent MemPhrase from and against any and/or all liabilities, costs, demands, causes of action, damages and expenses arising in any way related to your breach of any of the provisions of these Terms.
terms.severability.title: 8. Severability
terms.severability.description: If any provision of these Terms is found to be invalid under any applicable law, such provisions shall be deleted without affecting the remaining provisions herein.
terms.variation.title: 9. Variation of Terms
terms.variation.description: MemPhrase is permitted to revise these Terms at any time as it sees fit, and by using this Website you are expected to review these Terms on a regular basis.
terms.governing.title: 10. Governing Law & Jurisdiction
terms.governing.description: These Terms will be governed by and interpreted in accordance with the laws of the State/Country of Your Jurisdiction, and you submit to the non-exclusive jurisdiction of the state and federal courts located in Your Jurisdiction for the resolution of any disputes.

donate.subtitle: Support the development of MemPhrase by making a donation.
donate.intro: If you find MemPhrase useful, please consider supporting its ongoing development. Your contributions help keep the project alive, ad-free, and improving!

security.title: Password Security & MemPhrase
security.subtitle: Understanding password strength, entropy, how MemPhrase generates passwords, and general security tips.
security.strength.title: Understanding Password Strength & Entropy
security.strength.intro: A strong password is one that is difficult for humans or computers to guess. The strength of a password is often measured in entropy, which is expressed in "bits." The higher the entropy, the more unpredictable and secure your password is.
security.strength.length: Length: Longer passwords have significantly more entropy. Each additional character increases the number of possible combinations exponentially.
security.strength.charset: Character Set Size: This is the pool of unique characters used to create the password. A password using lowercase letters (26 options), uppercase letters (26), numbers (10), and symbols (e.g., ~28-32 common ones) has a much larger character set than one using only lowercase letters.
security.strength.formula: For example, a password of length L using a character pool of size N has an entropy of L * log‚ÇÇ(N) bits. MemPhrase calculates and displays this value to help you gauge the generated password's theoretical strength.
security.generation.title: How MemPhrase Generates Passwords
security.generation.words.title: 1. Word-based (Memorable Passphrases)
security.generation.words.intro: This mode focuses on creating passphrases that are easier for humans to remember while still maintaining good strength. It works by:
security.generation.words.selection: Selecting a specified number of words from chosen categories (e.g., adjectives, nouns, verbs). The diversity and size of the word lists in these categories contribute to entropy.
security.generation.words.capitalization: Optionally capitalizing each word (adds 1 bit of entropy per word).
security.generation.words.separator: Joining words with a chosen separator character.
security.generation.words.additions: Optionally adding a specified number of random digits (0-9) and symbols (from a customizable set). Each digit adds log‚ÇÇ(10) bits, and each symbol adds log‚ÇÇ(SymbolSetSize) bits.
security.generation.words.positioning: The position and grouping of these numbers and symbols can also be configured.
security.generation.words.goal: The goal is to balance memorability with cryptographic strength. Longer passphrases with more words and added random elements are stronger.
security.generation.random.title: 2. Random Characters (Strong Passwords)
security.generation.random.intro: This mode generates passwords that are typically harder to remember but can achieve very high entropy for their length. It works by:
security.generation.random.pool: Creating a character pool based on your selections: lowercase letters (a-z), uppercase letters (A-Z), numbers (0-9), and symbols (from a default set of ~28 or your customized set).
security.generation.random.selection: Randomly selecting characters from this pool to construct a password of your desired length (between 8 and 128 characters).
security.generation.random.strength: The strength of these passwords directly depends on the length and the size of the character pool used. For instance, including all character types creates a larger pool (e.g., 26+26+10+28 = 90 characters) than using only lowercase and numbers (26+10 = 36 characters).
security.tips.title: General Password Security Tips
security.tips.unique: Use Strong, Unique Passwords for Each Account: This is crucial. If one account is compromised, unique passwords prevent attackers from accessing your other accounts.
security.tips.length: Length Matters Most: After ensuring a good mix of character types, increasing length provides the biggest boost to security.
security.tips.2fa: Enable Two-Factor/Multi-Factor Authentication (2FA/MFA): This adds a critical second layer of security beyond just your password.
security.tips.obvious: Avoid Obvious Information: Don't use names, birthdays, pet names, or common dictionary words as standalone passwords.
security.tips.phishing: Be Wary of Phishing: Never enter your password on a site you reached via a suspicious link. Always verify the website's address (URL).
security.tips.updates: Keep Software Updated: Regular updates for your OS, browser, and applications often include security patches.
security.tips.passkeys: Consider Passkeys When Available: Passkeys are a newer, more secure alternative to passwords that use cryptographic key pairs. They are resistant to phishing and don't require you to remember complex strings. Look for options to use passkeys on websites and apps that support them.
security.managers.title: Using Password Managers
security.managers.intro: Given the need for long, unique, and complex passwords for every account, using a password manager is highly recommended. These tools securely generate and store your passwords, so you only need to remember one master password (make it a very strong one!).
security.managers.research: Below are some well-regarded password managers. We encourage you to research them to find one that fits your needs:
security.managers.disclaimer: Disclaimer: The listing of these password managers is for informational purposes only and does not constitute an endorsement by MemPhrase. Please conduct your own research before choosing any security product.
bulk.title: Bulk Generator
bulk.description: Generate multiple secure passphrases at once with full customization. Choose between memorable word-based passphrases or strong random character passwords. Perfect for creating unique passwords for multiple accounts.
bulk.word_based_desc: Easy to remember passphrases using real words
bulk.random_chars_desc: Maximum security with random character combinations
bulk.capitalize_desc: First letter of each word uppercase
bulk.efficiency_desc: Generate dozens of unique passwords in seconds. Perfect for setting up multiple accounts or team onboarding scenarios.
bulk.consistency_desc: All passwords follow the same security configuration, ensuring consistent strength and compliance across your organization.
bulk.export_desc: Export in multiple formats (TXT, CSV, JSON) for easy integration with password managers or deployment scripts.
bulk.security_notice: All passwords are generated locally in your browser. No data is transmitted to servers.

page.security_tips.title: Security Tips
page.security_tips.description: Essential security practices for protecting your digital accounts
page.main.title: MemPhrase - Free Passphrase Generator
page.main.description: Generate strong, memorable passphrases with MemPhrase. Create secure passwords using word combinations, random characters, and customizable settings. Free, private, and runs entirely in your browser.
page.secret.title: Secret Key Generator
page.secret.description: Generate strong, random cryptographic keys for your applications, APIs, and services. Perfect for JWT signing secrets, API authentication tokens, and encryption keys.
seo.bulk.title: Bulk Passphrase Generator - MemPhrase
seo.bulk.description: Generate multiple secure passphrases at once. Create 10-100 passphrases in bulk with full customization options.
seo.guide.title: Password Guide - Understanding Security & MemPhrase - MemPhrase
seo.guide.description: Learn about password strength, entropy, how MemPhrase generates passwords, general security tips, and password managers.
seo.certificate.title: Digital Certificate Generator - MemPhrase
seo.certificate.description: Generate self-signed X.509 digital certificates for development and testing. Create SSL/TLS certificates with configurable parameters and key sizes.
seo.recovery.title: Recovery Codes Generator - MemPhrase
seo.recovery.description: Generate secure backup recovery codes for account protection. Create one-time use codes for account recovery when 2FA devices are lost or unavailable.
seo.uuid.title: UUID/GUID Generator - MemPhrase
seo.uuid.description: Generate secure UUIDs (Universally Unique Identifiers) and GUIDs. Support for UUID v4 (random), v7 (timestamp-ordered), and v1 (MAC + timestamp) formats.
seo.secret.title: Secret Key Generator - MemPhrase
seo.secret.description: Generate strong, random cryptographic keys (Base64, Base64URL, Hex) for your applications.
seo.ssh.title: SSH Key Generator - MemPhrase
seo.ssh.description: Generate secure SSH key pairs with MemPhrase. Support for Ed25519, RSA, and ECDSA key types. Free, secure, and runs entirely in your browser.
seo.templates.title: Password Templates - MemPhrase
seo.templates.description: Pre-configured password templates for common requirements and use cases.
seo.checksum.title: Checksum Generator - MemPhrase
seo.checksum.description: Generate secure checksums and hashes for text and files. Support for SHA-256, SHA-512, SHA-1, and MD5 algorithms for data integrity verification.
tooltip.reset_defaults: Reset all options to their original defaults
aria.customize_symbols_random: Customize symbols for random character mode
aria.error_no_categories: Error: Please select at least one word category
text.pattern_tooltip: MemPhrase uses word patterns to make passphrases more memorable while maintaining security.
text.bulk_description_full: Generate multiple secure passphrases at once with full customization. Choose between memorable word-based passphrases or strong random character passwords. Perfect for creating unique passwords for multiple accounts.
text.guide_description_full: Learn about password security, entropy, how MemPhrase generates passwords, and best practices for protecting your digital accounts. Understand the science behind strong passwords.
text.certificate_description_full: Generate self-signed X.509 digital certificates for development, testing, and internal use. Perfect for local HTTPS development, testing SSL/TLS configurations, and internal applications.
text.recovery_description_full: Generate secure backup recovery codes for account protection. These one-time use codes help you regain access when your 2FA device is lost, stolen, or unavailable.
text.uuid_description_full: Generate cryptographically secure UUIDs (Universally Unique Identifiers) and GUIDs. Perfect for database keys, API tokens, session IDs, and unique identifiers.
text.secret_description_full: Generate strong, random cryptographic keys for your applications, APIs, and services. Perfect for JWT signing secrets, API authentication tokens, and encryption keys.
text.checksum_description_full: Generate secure checksums and hashes for data integrity verification. Support for SHA-256, SHA-512, SHA-1, and MD5 algorithms for text and files.
text.generate_instruction_words: Generate a new passphrase using the selected word categories and settings
text.generate_instruction_pronounceable: Generate a new pronounceable password with the specified complexity
text.generate_instruction_random: Generate a new random character password with the selected character types
text.tooltip_pattern: MemPhrase uses word patterns to make passphrases more memorable while maintaining security.
text.tooltip_word_count: Total number of words in your passphrase (1-7). More words significantly increase strength and memorability.
text.tooltip_word_categories: Settings for word-based part of the passphrase.
text.tooltip_capitalize: Capitalize the first letter of each word. e.g., QuickBrownFox.
text.tooltip_auto_copy: Automatically copy the generated passphrase to your clipboard.
text.tooltip_separator: Character(s) to place between words. Leave empty for no separator (words will be joined together). E.g., -, _, ., or space.
text.tooltip_numbers_symbols: Settings for including numbers and symbols in word-based passphrases.
text.tooltip_digits_count: How many digits to include (0-5). 0 means no digits.
text.tooltip_symbols_count: How many symbols to include (0-5). 0 means no symbols.
text.tooltip_customize_symbols: Customize which symbols are used for word-based passphrases.
text.tooltip_position: Where to place the numbers and/or symbols relative to the words.
text.tooltip_position_append: Add numbers/symbols at the end of the passphrase.
text.tooltip_position_prepend: Add numbers/symbols at the beginning of the passphrase.
text.tooltip_position_interspersed: Places numbers/symbols at random positions between words. If grouped separately, number block and symbol block are placed independently.
text.tooltip_grouping: How numbers and symbols are grouped if both are included.
text.tooltip_grouping_together: Numbers and symbols are combined into a single block (e.g., 123#$%)
text.tooltip_grouping_separate: If selected, number blocks and symbol blocks can be placed independently when 'Interspersed'. For 'Append'/'Prepend', they are added sequentially.
text.tooltip_syllables: Number of syllables in the pronounceable password. More syllables create longer, stronger passwords.
text.tooltip_complexity: Controls the complexity of syllable patterns. Simple uses basic consonant-vowel patterns, while complex includes digraphs and trigraphs.
text.tooltip_simple: Basic patterns with simple consonants and vowels. Easier to pronounce and type.
text.tooltip_balanced: Moderate complexity with common letter combinations. Good balance of security and usability.
text.tooltip_complex: Advanced patterns with complex consonant clusters and vowel combinations. Maximum security.
text.tooltip_formatting: General formatting options for pronounceable passwords.
text.tooltip_capitalize_first: Capitalize the first letter of the password.
text.tooltip_auto_copy_password: Automatically copy the generated password to your clipboard.
text.tooltip_pronounceable_numbers: Settings for including numbers and symbols in pronounceable passwords.
text.tooltip_pronounceable_symbols: Customize which symbols are used for pronounceable passwords.
text.tooltip_pronounceable_position: Where to place the numbers and/or symbols relative to the pronounceable password.
text.tooltip_pronounceable_append: Add numbers/symbols at the end of the password.
text.tooltip_pronounceable_prepend: Add numbers/symbols at the beginning of the password.
text.tooltip_pronounceable_interspersed: Places numbers/symbols at random positions within the pronounceable password.
text.tooltip_random_length: Length of the random character password (8-128 characters). Longer passwords are more secure.
text.tooltip_random_character_types: Select which types of characters to include in your random password.
text.tooltip_random_numbers_symbols: Settings for including numbers and symbols in random character passwords.
text.tooltip_random_symbols: Customize which symbols are used for random passwords.
text.tooltip_random_formatting: General formatting options for random character passwords.
text.tooltip_random_position: Where to place the numbers and/or symbols in the random password.
text.tooltip_random_grouping: How numbers and symbols are grouped in the random password.
text.no_character_types_error: Please select at least one character type.
text.reset_tooltip: Reset all options to their original defaults
text.privacy_notice: All passwords are generated entirely in your browser and are never stored or transmitted.
text.footer_notice: MemPhrase is free, open-source, and privacy-focused. Your passwords never leave your device.
